alert.note: Alert for Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Above 11000 Ft; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 3:46AM MST until February 24 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of around 1 to 2 feet. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE... Sangre de Cristo Mountains. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin earlier in the day Tuesday, but the heaviest snow will not start until later during the afternoon and evening Tuesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
